origination.corpname: J. Walter Thompson Company. Frankfurt Office.

did.unittitle: J. Walter Thompson Company. Frankfurt Office. Audiovisual Materials 1956-1993 and undated
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Founded in 1864, the J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) is one of the oldest and largest enduring advertising agencies in the United States. The Frankfurt Office opened in 1952. The J. Walter Thompson Company Frankfurt Office Audiovisual Materials span the years 1956-1993 and consist of 16mm and 35mm films, videocassettes and slides that document print advertisements and television commercials produced by the Frankfurt Office for the German and continental European markets. Companies represented include Braun, De Beers, Elida Gibbs (Chesebrough-Pond's), Findus, Ford, Glückslee, Hoffman's, Jacobs (Kraft), Kellogg's, Kraft, Maggi, Pepsi, Sunlicht (Unilever), and Wick. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Original audiovisual materials are closed to patron use. Some use copies are available in the collection. Otherwise, Research Services staff need to produce use copies before contents can be accessed.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], J. Walter Thompson Company. Frankfurt Office. Audiovisual Materials, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company. Frankfurt Office. Audiovisual Materials were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 1996.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection is minimally processed: materials may not have been ordered and described beyond their original condition.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) Frankfurt Office Audiovisual Materials span the years 1956-1993 and consist of 16mm and 35mm films, videocassettes and slides that document print advertisements and television commercials produced by the Frankfurt Office for the German and continental European markets. Companies represented include Braun, De Beers, Elida Gibbs (Chesebrough-Pond's), Findus, Ford, Glückslee, Hoffman's, Jacobs (Kraft), Kellogg's, Kraft, Maggi, Pepsi, Sunlicht (Unilever), and Wick.

arrangement.head: Collection Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is arranged in five series: Commercials by Client; Oversize Materials; Videocassettes; Slides; and Use Copies.

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
controlaccess.p: These are searchable subject entries for this collection. Performing a search on these subjects in the Duke University Libraries online catalog will bring up other related research materials.

scopecontent.p: [Multiple clients and numerous commercials on each reel presumably used for corporate or new business presentations.]

did.unittitle: Compilation reels (Musterolles): See also Oversize Reels (15 reels), 1960s-1970s
Corporate presentations: See also Oversize Reels (10 reels), 1960s-1970s
Commercials by client including Dt. Bank, Mentdadent, ATM/Mr. Cash, Jacobs TV history, De Beers, Andrex, Kraft, DEA, Elida, Bacardi.

Commercials by clients and competitors including Lowenbrau, Perrier, MRM’s TV history, Young & Rubicam’s Amaretto (1988), Bacardi TV history, CD case history, Tires for the World, Nestle’s chocolate eggs, various Easter Egg commercials, 1980s

Compilations of commercials including fruit drinks, Russian compilation, and several JWT highlights (1988, 1992, undated). Also contains 1 audio cassette of radio spots for various products, circa 1992

Mostly showreels (presumably compilations of commercials used for various presentations) including Effective Creativity Showreel (1992), JWT Europe Multinational clients (1993), EuroMontage (1989), circa 1993

Corporate presentations including Satellite Wars (1989), JWT-London An Approach to New Business, Windows of Change: Key social Trends in Developing Nations (1988), A Country Called Deutschland (1991), Eyes on Thompson (1991-1992), JWT--A Worldwide Powerhouse, The Brain Game, circa 1990

scopecontent.p: [Images of print advertisements used in various corporate or new business presentations. While most are arranged by client, others appear to be a mix of clients (JWT and competitive). There may also be slides of statistics, charts, etc. which were used in presentations as well.]

did.unittitle: Includes Braun, Dt. Wein, and Alpi, undated
Includes De Beers, Platin, Glucksklee, Wick, and Johnson.
Includes case history or credential presentations for Bacardi, CD, Platin, Ford, Phillips, and De Beers.
Corporate presentations related to JWT history, Phillips, plus some miscellaneous, undated
Corporate presentations including BOR presentation, Okal case history, and various miscellaneous and unidentified, undated

Includes case histories for Mr. Cash, pet food, Andrex, and Wick; UK print ads, the New German; Joe O’Donnell visit in 1986 History and Today’s Management. Also contains the audio cassette tape Deutschlands Jingle-Hits (3 sets) and an audio record for Friskies (6 copies), circa 1986
